intro: Linaria italica var. strictissima, commonly known as the Italian toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a perennial herbaceous plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces bright yellow or orange flowers in racemes. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders.
